command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol=[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ts=Get-Date -Format o; try { $b=[Convert]::ToBase64String([Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$env:PT_USER`:$env:PT_KEY")); $headers=@{ 'Authorization'="Basic $b"; 'Accept'='application/json' }; $r=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://api.passivetotal.org/v2/enrichment/subdomains?query=contoso.com' -Headers $headers -Method Get -ErrorAction Stop; ($r.Content | ConvertFrom-Json | Select-Object -Property query,subdomains | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6) | Out-File -FilePath "$env:TEMP\passivetotal_subdomains_contoso.json" -Encoding utf8; Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts PassiveTotal success contoso.com" } catch { Add-Content -Path "$env:TEMP\recon.log" -Value "$ts PassiveTotal error: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Uses RiskIQ PassiveTotal (paid/closed) with Basic auth to enumerate subdomains for a target domain, extracting structured data and logging the transaction.
rationale_steps: Form secure Basic auth header from environment credentials.
Query closed-source subdomain enrichment endpoint for the target.
Select relevant fields and save as JSON.
Write minimal operational logs without sensitive data.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper syntax, balanced quotes/braces, correct error handling with try/catch, and appropriate variable declarations and method calls.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by using RiskIQ PassiveTotal API (a paid threat intelligence service) with proper authentication to gather subdomain intelligence about a target domain, storing results, and logging the activity.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The command is perfectly well-formed, with correct syntax for PowerShell cmdlets, variable assignments, control structures (try-catch), and API interaction components like headers and URI.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by querying a known paid/closed intelligence source (PassiveTotal) for subdomain enumeration, using realistic API authentication, data extraction, and local logging, all operationally plausible for an adversary.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: Well-formed PowerShell with balanced delimiters, valid hashtable and pipeline syntax, proper headers, and correct use of try/catch and TLS setting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: Authenticates to and queries the paid RiskIQ PassiveTotal API for subdomains, processes JSON, writes results, and logs activity, aligning precisely with T1597 use of closed sources.
